evals.prompt: Here's our regional performance data. Build me a board deck for the CFO — we need approval for a $200K marketing investment in the highest-margin region. Use the data to tell the story.
evals.expected_output: A 7-10 slide .pptx executive deck with action titles, verified charts, anchoring devices on evidence slides, inaction framing on the recommendation, and a clean comparison of investment options across regions.
assertions: Every slide title is an action title (states a conclusion, not a topic label)
Executive Summary slide contains large KPI callouts (60-72pt) and an explicit ask
At least one evidence slide includes an anchoring device (scale comparison, contrast frame, or metaphor)
Recommendation slide includes an inaction/cost-of-delay frame
All charts are generated (not suggested) and embedded in the deck
All numbers on slides match the auditor's Verified Metrics
No accent lines under titles
Body text on any slide does not exceed ~50 words
Deck follows the narrative arc: Title → Exec Summary → Burning Platform/Evidence → Options → Recommendation → Risks
The deck outline was presented for user approval before building

evals.prompt: I have quarterly revenue data for 6 product lines. Make an executive presentation for the CEO showing which product lines to sunset and which to double down on. The CEO needs to decide by end of quarter.
evals.expected_output: A decision-focused deck that categorizes product lines by performance, uses contrast framing to highlight the gap between winners and losers, and presents 2-3 strategic options with quantified trade-offs.
assertions: Briefing questions are asked before building (at minimum: which KPIs define 'sunset' vs 'double down')
Burning Platform slide creates urgency around the end-of-quarter deadline
Evidence slides use contrast framing between strong and weak product lines
Options slide presents 2-3 paths with projected impact, not just 'sunset these ones'
Inaction frame is present: what happens if no decision is made this quarter
Charts are generated and match verified data

evals.prompt: Turn this data into a board presentation. Just make it look good.
evals.expected_output: The skill should ask at minimum what decision the board needs to make, then proceed with defaults for everything else. Should not build slides without understanding the purpose.
assertions: The agent asks at least the decision question (#2) before building
The agent does NOT dump all 5 briefing questions as a wall of text
After getting the decision answer, the agent proceeds without over-questioning
Default styling is applied (dark title/conclusion slides, light content slides, no generic blue)
Output is a complete .pptx file, not just an outline or suggestions
